## Nos Gestes Climat, v1

> In a nutshell: 
&gt 
> The action screen has been completely redesigned, with two paths and more gestures
> - the application has been partly redesigned: it's more modern and pleasant to use, especially on mobiles
> - we've introduced *personas*, so you can work more effectively on your next actions
> - share your simulation results on networks, and people will see a capture of your results straight away!

## Take action

We've completely redesigned the /actions screen.

We now have access to two modes, a guided one where actions are sorted by you, and a stand-alone one that lets you tackle the biggest reduction gestures.

![Capture d‚Äô√©cran du 2021-03-29 15-53-21](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/112846986-e5d75f00-90a6-11eb-8ca0-1be5736d5d9c.png)

## Redesign of the application, especially on mobile

- we've adopted the conventions of the modern mobile, with finger-accessible navigation buttons at the bottom, and a session bar giving the simulation result also at the bottom and permanently visible

![Capture d‚Äô√©cran du 2021-03-29 11-05-15 resized](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/112813673-c3c9e680-907e-11eb-94c9-b818073b7c45.png)

- we've gained vertical space on mobile. Why is this important? To make phones < 6 inches last. Not because 6 inches is bad, but because changing phones just for the screen is a shame. It won't revolutionize our footprint, but it's something!

Big new feature that lets you preview simulation results when sharing on social networks.

This system, to be populated with profiles that are as representative of the population as possible, will enable us to better test and develop the application.

![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2b/Guadeloupe_from_ISS.jpg/640px-Guadeloupe_from_ISS.jpg?uselang=fr) > The island of Guadeloupe > In brief : > - the first regional version to extend beyond mainland France > A contributory internationalization platform > - ongoing improvements to the model: default values for heating, air conditioning and biogas ## NGC international üó∫Ô∏è We're launching internationalization and regionalization with our first new territory: Guadeloupe! This essential work, which had been put aside for the time being, was prompted by the initiative of MOLOKO√è, a company committed to fighting climate change in its region, and Samuel Charvet, a student at the University of the West Indies in Point-√†-Pitre.

The customization of the electricity mix factor, localized suggestions for air travel and the addition of inter-island ferries are the main features of the Guadeloupe version, which will obviously undergo further development. This is just the first building block, our aim being to create a community of contributors first in France, then in Europe and the rest of the world. ## Air conditioning added ‚ùÑÔ∏è Differentiating the model for Guadeloupe has enabled us to realize the importance of air conditioning, and the relative importance of heating (for hot water) in this tropical region where no month is significantly colder than another. Initially reserved for Guadeloupe, we have extended this air-conditioning model to mainland France (in fact, the standard model at this stage, as it is historical), given the scale of air-conditioning equipment in 2020: 25% of households will be equipped. Its footprint is twofold: its electricity consumption (particularly carbon-intensive in Guadeloupe) *and* its greenhouse gas leakage, which is significant (several hundred kg of CO2e per air conditioner per year) even in a France with a decarbonized electricity mix. The subject is complex (as it often is), so this model is just a first iteration to be refined. ## Biogas üî•üå± It's an oft-asked question: what about "green gas", also known as biogas and, more precisely, biomethane? We investigatedthe impact of biogas and validated the possibility of adding it to our calculation, and now it's done. > ‚ö†Ô∏è Please note, however, that this is by no means a perfect solution, and should not replace a more sustainable reduction in gas consumption through electrification, sobriety and energy efficiency. ## Heating: average values üå°Ô∏è A study of average heating simulation values was carried out by carefully analyzing French housing statistics. ## Tech ‚öôÔ∏è As you may know, the special feature of ourgestesclimat is that it is a form generated from an open calculation model. This makes it particularly robust to changes, because we don't painstakingly order questions by hand, and we don't recode entanglements like "if the user said he lived in an apartment, then don't ask him about the lawnmower": everything is managed for us. The management of "mosaic" questions (such as the "heating" checkboxes or the choice of lunch and dinner menus) has been improved, and now resides directly in the model, alongside the other questions! What's in it for us? It allows contributors who don't want to bother with Javascript (and other coding considerations) to modify the questions in an easy-to-use language.

By way of example, this can be useful for organizing an organization-wide survey while allowing results to be filtered by respondent type (status...), age, location (taking care, of course, not to compromise RGPD standards). We have also been working on survey security to prevent the introduction of vulnerabilities into our database via this feature. You'll find all the details in our documentation! * **Better filtering of the group mode view page In the previous version, any user who logged in to the survey appeared in the visualization graph. This meant that some people counted as 1 participant without even having taken the test (with a score corresponding to the default values), and ghost visits distorted the results (especially the mean value!). The way both to highlight our dependence on these fossil fuels and to better visualize the impact of the actions we can put in place: the number of trips to the pump speaks louder than tons of CO‚ÇÇe, so swipe on the end screen to see your oil impact! ## Calculation model improvements üßÆ * **Caravan & motorhome added** There's now more choice in Nos Gestes Climat for your vacations! ![it's at the National Assembly in the 7th arrondissement of Paris that the State budget is voted each year](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/205978955-88a0ad61-244c-4afb-89a9-600eef3a5f1c.jpg) If you've ever done a carbon footprint test, you may have noticed a rather surprising category: public services. Approximately 1 tonne out of the French average 10 tonnes of CO‚ÇÇ‚Çë in order of magnitude, this may not seem like much.... Only, for those who adopt a rather low-carbon lifestyle, and more generally in relation to the 2-tonne individual footprint target (remember that the important thing is not the target but the transition scenario), 1 tonne can legitimately look like an elephant in the room! In this article, we tell you all about this famous "public services" or now "societal services" item in NGC: how it's calculated, what it's made up of, and how we've just used these figures to make a **‚ú® new version of the nosgestesclimat.fr** calculation model. ## The average French person emits 8.9 tons (November 2022) France, like many other countries, has set commitments to reduce its climate footprint and has defined a strategy to achieve this. To get there, we obviously need to know *where we are* today and how things are evolving each year. This is the task of the French Ministry of Ecology's Service des donn√©es et √©tudes statistiques, which estimates that our climate footprint will be 8.9 tonnes per person in 2021. How is this figure calculated? The calculation method is clever and transparent, but relatively difficult to understand, so we'll try to explain it more simply here. Basically, to calculate a climate footprint, you need to start from a physical reality. We have to calculate the actual greenhouse gas emissions (well, estimate it) of a concrete action: for example we know that burning 1 liter of gasoline in a car emits around 2.7 kg of CO‚ÇÇ‚Çë. Then we can count the liters of diesel burned by French semi-trailers, by barges on rivers, by boats, planes and so on. The problem, then, is to derive the footprint of other sectors, which don't burn these fossil fuels directly. For example, a hospital buys wooden furniture but does not manufacture or transport it itself. The furniture is cut in a factory, which purchased it. To do this, a truck delivered planks of wood. This wood has been treated by the chemical industry, and produced by the forestry sector (wood management), which uses diesel chainsaws, etc. The administration doesn't have a precise description of all these transactions (kg of wood, volume of oil and paint, etc.), but it does have the exchanges in ‚Ç¨ between all these sectors, at an aggregated level over the year, which we call macro. Thanks to these monetary exchanges, a matrix calculation can be used to assign each sector the carbon footprint of its added value! In simple terms: we obtain an estimate of greenhouse gas emissions according to which sector bought from which other sector. Returning to our hospital example, we can therefore estimate the carbon footprint of the healthcare sector, even if the exact details of each hospital's consumption are not known. These calculations are made periodically. The latest accurate version is for 2017, and the latest (less accurate) estimate is for 2021. ## Define the perimeter of a base allocated to each French person Summing up the footprint of all these sectors, divided by the country's population, gives the so-called "macro" footprint per person. In parallel, the nosgestesclimat calculation model is a compilation of so-called "micro" models: you are asked a multitude of questions to reconstruct *your carbon footprint* from physical consumption data. > These are two perspectives on the same physical reality, two very different methods producing two figures, which fortunately converge around 9 tonnes of CO‚ÇÇ‚Çë. The two methods are very different, but complementary for all that: indeed, analysis by consumption cannot capture all the emissions of a French person. While the nosgestesclimat micro method can easily calculate the footprint of your car mileage, it is incapable of estimating the footprint of the public services you use on a diffuse basis all year round, as well as commercial services such as the fiber and mobile internet network, which most of the population enjoy (albeit to varying degrees) on a latent basis. We therefore need to adopt a hybrid model, mixing micro and macro. > It's easy to estimate the climate footprint of a truck, car or motorcycle. But what about the footprint of this regularly repaved road? The maintenance of road signs? The footprint of the National Assembly itself? The aim is to define the perimeter of these complementary worlds to avoid double counting, and thus obtain the final value of the constant societal services, the sum of public services and commercial services, attributed to each French citizen. ![Recording 2022-12-15 at 14 02 25](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/207865812-a37bbe96-2acd-4f0b-b9b5-ed64e93597da.gif) ## A first calculation We therefore analyzed the macro footprint data shared by SDES, sector by sector, line by line, to include a share, from 0 to 100%, of the societal services footprint. > It should be remembered that the aim is always to **obtain orders of magnitude**: it is not a question of claiming a result to the nearest ten kg of CO2. In this respect, it should be remembered that our climate objectives target a 90% reduction in our footprint. The "Public administration and defense" line obviously includes 100% of public services as a matter of course: citizens have no influence on these sovereign positions other than through their vote and public commitment. The same applies to the "Education" line. On the other hand, things are more complicated for the "üèóÔ∏è construction" line: it includes many different activities that benefit society as a whole, but we don't have details of their carbon footprint. An allocation is therefore made on the basis of the sales of the sub-branches and sub-sub-branches published by INSEE, and these are the % figures you can see in our documentation.
Find out more about the breakdown by sales of SDES carbon data > The data provided by SDES gives a carbon footprint corresponding to what is consumed on French territory by economic branch (e.g.: E36 = water distribution network = 677 kTCO‚ÇÇ‚Çë) or by group of economic branches (e.g.: F41_43 = Construction = 54116 kTCO‚ÇÇ‚Çë). For this data, there is therefore a first level of aggregation, which we have chosen to disaggregate according to the branch's share of sales in the grouping proposed by SDES (e.g. for F41_43, we have F41=25%, F42=13.5%, F43=61.5%) > > As some data are secret, we have assumed that they are also secret for the calculation of the national carbon footprint. In the absence of further information, we have chosen not to consider them in these decomposition calculations. > > To go even further, we sometimes needed a higher level of precision by looking at economic sub-branches. Indeed, if we take the example of E38 relating to waste collection, only sub-branches E3812 and E3822, concerning hazardous waste, were to be included in public services. We have therefore also used the breakdown by sales to highlight the carbon intensity associated with the sub-branches in question within E38.
As far as market services are concerned, we have tried to include in the basic footprint consumption that is relatively universal (e.g., everyone has to take out home insurance) or that is not yet taken into account by our micro models (e.g., consumption of telecommunications services), but which may be one day. If you're interested, you can explore our documentation explaining and justifying this allocation via the public services and market services pages. It's quite "expert", but we've done our best for a first version, and your feedback will be invaluable. ## The result Here's a photograph of our hybrid model. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/207576758-03cfbc96-a6a2-4817-a4cb-4c4562342783.png) ‚ö†Ô∏è Please note that this graph does not represent a reliable average value for the climate footprint of a French person, contrary to the SDES figure of 8.9t, but simply the anatomy of our hybrid calculation model. Values are subject to regular change, in full transparency. The aim of Nos Gestes Climat remains to estimate the footprint associated with a real person's lifestyle. In this respect, the aim of future versions is precisely to cover many items currently left out üêïÔ∏è‚õ¥Ô∏èüõµ‚ö°Ô∏èüè°. See you soon!

![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/88/Aletschgletscher-Eggishorn.jpg/800px-Aletschgletscher-Eggishorn.jpg) > The Aletsch Glacier is the largest glacier in the Alps, located in southern Switzerland in the canton of Valais. ‚û°Ô∏è France Info report. A nod to Switzerland, which motivated the regionalization of Nos Gestes Climat's calculations. **In brief** : - üë• The course of the group mode (conference and survey) has been improved - ü™∂ Performance improvements: we're concerned about the site's lightness - üë§ The profile page is slowly improving - üá®üá≠ New version of model internationalization, including Switzerland - üßÆ Improved calculation model - üêû Bug fixes ## Group mode improvements Nos Gestes Climat's group mode is being used more and more! If you've tried it out, you'll have noticed a few bugs and inconveniences. Fortunately, here's a first salvo of improvements for the new year. ### Display of number of participants *and* number of completed tests In group mode, we only displayed an indicator for the number of participants. But what about participants who are logged in but haven't finished or even started their test? We now present two indicators: - the number of people connected (conference) or having registered their participation in the survey (survey) - the number of people who have completed their test, meaning they have answered at least 90% of the questions ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/217204345-6c657130-7177-4229-bae3-b71e4dbebe97.png) This change should make it much easier to welcome participants to a group session. It's up to you to tell us ;-) ### Simplified welcome on the survey link The user's welcome on a survey link has been simplified: the "Take the test" button is no longer displayed on the same page as the "Participate" button, which must be clicked to take part in a survey. ### üßÆ Better explanation of graphs and averages Usually during a conference or survey, a moderator is there to explain the visualization page to users. If this isn't the case, here's a minimum explanation. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/217012881-e9e7a66b-1792-4073-8d50-f5aee5c6aadf.png) ### üî° Simplified survey names We no longer allow spaces in survey names to avoid typos. We've also added a screen to guide the user trying to access a non-existent survey. > In the past, to launch a survey, all you had to do was connect to an address. Now, the organizer must first create a poll on the group page. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/217201362-b12fd578-1ea5-40e0-b749-2081e3ba2bce.png) ## Optimization & performance ### Reduced size of template loaded from site We've greatly reduced the size of the calculation model loaded from the site: it's now **2 times lighter** ü™∂. >
More technical info on this reduction here > > We have developed a new compression tool for our calculation model. > > Indeed, in the interests of transparency and explicability, we try to be as precise and complete as possible when writing new models: this requires a breakdown into sub-rules and the creation of a (very thick) tree. This is the case for calculatingthe footprint of waste, for example. While this complexity is necessary to understand the calculation, it is not necessary to execute it. > > This new tool therefore makes it possible to transform all the sub-branches of a calculation into a single value when this does not depend on the user's answers. This is the case for waste, but also for societal services, whose footprint is the same for every French person. > >
But why download the calculation to your browser rather than to our servers like other sites? There are two main reasons: - nosgestesclimat.fr respects your privacy as much as possible: we don't **collect** your precious information (car kilometers, diet, m¬≤, etc...) ; - once the test is loaded, you use it like a mobile application: no need for an internet connection to answer the dozens of test questions. ### Faster documentation pages & various site improvements In the same vein as reducing the weight of the calculation model, we've reduced the initial loading time of the model's documentation pages, which allow anyone to explore the entire individual carbon footprint calculation. The calculation is now loaded in a "lazy" way, only at the click of a button, to display basic information more quickly. More info here. At the same time, we've reduced the weight of other pages, and added a loading indicator that evokes the new Nos Gestes Climat logo. ![Nouvelle animation de chargement](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/216140755-3c81d0e7-6cc2-4d56-82e3-9b851e9615ba.gif) A footer now allows you to consult the `About`, `Documentation` pages and even this `News` section from the rest of the site on desktop. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/220296173-d8b2a9a7-320e-4437-9e00-ff7d5e31caed.png) ## üë§ Improved /profile page Although we don't offer a logged-in user account, your profile page stores your simulation data until you delete "your cookies". We've improved it, with a button to unfold all test responses. This also enables reusers of our calculation model to list the questions asked by Nos Gestes Climat. ![Recording 2023-02-21 at 09 51 35](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/220295631-3fe9a9d9-81f1-45cd-a2fa-a19c8584d7f0.gif) > üí° Tip: we haven't yet publicly released our personas page, which allows you to view the site as one of 9 typical users, from a 3-tonne score to a 16-tonne score. However, you can use it to explore our calculation model. More on this soon ;) ## üè≥Ô∏è Internationalization We've just released a more powerful version of our internationalization platform. It allows us to launch a beta version of a Swiss calculation model, but above all to facilitate the welcoming of new countries! As far as possible, the question titles are no longer specific to France, particularly for the "Airplane" questions. This allows us to make the test comprehensible to people from all over the world. On the other hand, the suggestions ("a metropolitan flight") remain linked to the test region for greater personalization. Please note that these changes are only textual and do not affect emission factors. ## üî† Translation Translation scripts have been improved to better handle external contributions that would modify automatic translations for model translations for the time being). This will soon enable us to scale up to **translate Nos Gestes Climat into many languages**. ## üßÆ Calculation model improvements ### üèõÔ∏è More clarity on the societal services method The calculation scripts that enabled us to release the latest version have been improved, and a methodological guide has been added to the wiki. Bugs have been corrected. ### üìà‚Ç¨ Gas price update The input help for switching from ‚Ç¨ to kWh for the annual gas consumption question is now up to date with the latest rates! ### üöó Correction of "Car" model We have adjusted the scope of the emission factor linked to car manufacturing. Indeed, in the first version of this model, we had chosen to subtract "recycling credits" corresponding to emissions avoided via the use of recycled materials from the dismantling of a car, for the production of new manufactured products. On reflection, we assume that the reduced footprint benefits the purchaser of the recycled product, and not the purchaser of a product destined for recycling. It's an assumption we've already applied to all NGC models! ## Bug corrections Simulation graphics were mistakenly frozen during testing; this has now been corrected. We've also added a button that opens the detailed graph on click. ![Recording 2023-02-21 at 10 09 31](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/220299822-c7eb9679-ca52-4bf9-a26c-bc1a4392f0c8.gif) ## ü•≥ External contributions We're delighted with the increase in relevant external contributions. These include: - a bug fixed by @mlbiche, - many pertinent questions from @marc-marc-marc and the rest of the community üôè, - a Portuguese-language version of the site thanks to @micaelbatista. See you soon!

body: ![the Vatnaj√∂kull Glacier](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d7/Breidamerkurjoekull.jpg/640px-Breidamerkurjoekull.jpg) > Vatnaj√∂kull is Iceland's largest ice cap. It is the second largest glacier in Europe. **In brief** : - ‚ú® New recruitments - üåç The test is now adapted for some fifteen new regions and countries - üßÆ Calculation model improved: pets, ferry, airplane, household appliances, furniture, heat networks, etc. - üë• Further improvements to group mode - üì± Improved display for small screens - ü™≤ Bug fixes ## ‚ú® Recruitments We're delighted to welcome 5 new people to the Nos Gestes Climat team, with the aim of scaling up in terms of disseminating and improving the tool: - Denis, developer - Margaux, deployment manager - J√©r√©mie, designer - Benjamin, Web developer - Julie, carbon model expert ## üåç Internationalization of the calculation model ### A new international home page Discover our new homepage: *Theinternational climate footprint calculator.** ![Page d'accueil internationale](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/234643345-39f53d27-e0f4-4a0a-881b-38a3985721e1.png) ### 15 new countries and regions added Many new countries have been added to Nos Gestes Climat. Portugal, United Kingdom, Belgium, Italy, etc. ![Mosa√Øque des pays](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/234643447-50e4387d-e122-49a6-b7c0-c84399d08ccc.png) Are you comfortable with the subject of carbon, or are you motivated to contribute? There's plenty of scope for adding a new country or region. The principle is simple: write a set of differences between the carbon footprint of France, the basis of the model, and that of another region. As an example, an external contributor himself proposed an extension for Tunisia, which we put online a week later. This was also the case for Guadeloupe, one of the first models to be added. In particular, the electricity mix, regional specificities, customized emission factors if they exist, air flight recommendations (for example, Paris‚ÜíAthens could be replaced by Rome ‚Üí Tunis), etc. It's up to you! Thanks to Electricity Map for allowing us to use the consumption mix data of the countries supported on NGC! More technical info here. ## üßÆ Calculation model improvements Our calculation model is constantly being improved. We've pulled out all the stops this spring, with a host of much-requested new features. ### More choice of furniture and appliances The model for calculating the footprint of furnishings has been completed, with more choices and updated footprints. ![Nouvel √©cran meubles](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/234643519-9b9589b0-1bcd-49ba-b3d1-320ff377fbc9.png) The same applies to household appliances. For example, if you've just moved house or remodeled your kitchen, this could be an opportunity to reassess your footprint. ![Electrom√©nager](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/234643708-4d3ff9ef-dafd-422f-981d-2eac7e782b67.png) ### Pets Our little (and not so little) furry friends have joined Nos Gestes Climat with a new dedicated question! ![Nouvelle question animaux domestiques](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/234643987-533d60de-5c3b-4cdb-a687-0e432b17ff3f.png) If you've got a dog or a cat, you know that you have to feed them. And food is an important part of our climate footprint. A golden opportunity to redo the test and discover the impact of this footprint item. ### Recording airplane hours over 3 years We were well aware that for most French people (70%), flying is a mode of travel that is not used every year. As a result, many people who are concerned about global warming first decide to reduce their flights by spreading them out over time. We've made the issue more flexible with a mini amortization calculator ‚ú®. ![√âcran d'amortissement des heures d'avion](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/234644247-67056d75-ff76-474f-b125-621e9126fdc3.png) ### The ferry Many of you asked us why ferry journeys, particularly to the many islands bordering France and its overseas territories, were not included in the test. This is finally the case: by 2023, ferries will still be almost exclusively fossil-fuelled transport. The difficulty we had in adding this question was attributing the boat's footprint. This is because a ferry provides a wide range of transport services: in a cabin, in an armchair; with a car, with a caravan; freight transport, to supply the island or the mainland; on-board services such as restaurants and bars; variable-speed crossings; and so on. ![Question ferry](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/234644330-b0f1633f-648f-460c-92ce-6990465d6cda.png) To avoid drowning you in questions, we've chosen an average passenger profile. We'll then take you through the details of a real ticket, as your ticket choices can change the footprint of your crossing completely, as you can see on this dedicated mini-simulator. ### More choice of heating sources For those lucky enough to already have their own heating system, we've added the option of a "heat network", a heating system that's set to become increasingly widespread thanks to the work of our friends at France Chaleur Urbaine. ![R√©seaux de chaleur](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/234644422-20a6c82d-1b3e-44fa-9ca8-b009bab1bbab.png) We've also thought about households with gas tanks üëçÔ∏è. ### Various model improvements On the transport front, statistical analysis has shown that many people use a Light Commercial Vehicle (LCV), also known as a "van", to get around in their personal lives. This is now an option for your car's size. To help you, you can enter your heating oil consumption in ‚Ç¨ rather than kWh. But prices are changing! We've updated them. Similarly, the carbon footprint of **gas** has been updated. If a user entered "zero" to the questions "number of inhabitants in the dwelling" or "number of car-poolers", this would cause the site to crash, with the dreaded **division by zero** üòì (even though these are undesirable answers). This has now been corrected! ## üë• Group mode improvements Nos Gestes Climat's group mode lets you test with others, whether in a small group of friends, a company, or at a conference with an interactive experience. Here are the improvements to this mode: - a new menu item lets you discover and access group mode from anywhere in the application - the menu is easier to navigate: the active tab is more prominently displayed - when you join a group session, a clearly visible group session bar appears at the top of the page on both mobile and desktop, allowing you to return to the group session page with a single click - after joining a group session, if you close the tab and reopen it, the session is still active: we store it in the browser's memory - my ability to view only completed tests on the group mode screen - a host of discreet improvements **to this increasingly popular mode** - üî≠ coming soon: a brand-new, more professional and less interactive group mode for actual surveys. ## üì± Better management of small screens Particular attention continues to be paid to making the user experience fluid on small screen sizes. This includes **simplifying the menu bar** : ![Screen_Shot_2023-04-06_at_15 54 50](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/234644562-f48479e1-d6b3-422b-afae-09039b402e0c.png) And the **highlighting of home page buttons**: ![Screen_Shot_2023-04-06_at_16 10 02](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/234644593-50e57c58-96bb-4220-ae8c-9abc8a7a9415.png) **The display of questions in *mosaic* form has also been reworked along these lines**. For both *numeric* and *checkbox* questions: ![Screen_Shot_2023-04-06_at_16 26 50](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/234644637-6e350aed-2a39-48b1-afc4-d374379a90a4.png) ![Screen_Shot_2023-04-06_at_16 34 22](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/234644659-517987a7-8775-4aa3-b49c-726b65629cec.png) ## üîß Tech ### Improved Publicodes programming language The NGC calculation model is written in the Publicodes programming language. The model is now several thousand lines of code long, so it's important for us to follow and participate in the development of the Publicodes project so that we can make the language evolve in the right direction for NGC. Over the last few weeks** we've been able to add a new average mechanism to Publicodes** to make the calculations in the Furnishings sub-model more comprehensible, for example, by calculating the bed's footprint. In addition, several greenhouse gas calculation models written in Publicodes exist outside the NGC model, such as futur.eco. Technical solutions were therefore put in place to enable us to **reuse them without having to duplicate the code**. *This enabled us to integrate futureco's ferry calculation model into Nos Gestes Climat without reinventing the wheel! ### Various improvements Nos Gestes Climat now supports the storage of **several simulations** in the user profile. For the moment, it's not much use. But it's a building block for the future.. Each time the calculation model is modified, we now track the evolution of the footprint of each typical person encoded in NGC. In this way, if a significant and unexpected increase is observed, we can check for a potential error. To reinforce the site's reliability, we have implemented : - automated tests (Cypress) that simulate a user in dozens of paths: no more blank pages! - automatic error tracking (Sentry), because no test is ever infallible: we'll know more easily when errors are triggered and which ones to correct first Translation management of the site and template have been improved to make the experience smoother and less restrictive for language contributors, with the aim of facilitating the addition of new languages in the future. ## ü™≤ Miscellaneous bugs - https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat-site/pull/781 - https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat-site/pull/903 - https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat-site/pull/905 - https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat/pull/1802 - https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat-site/pull/893 - https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat-site/pull/849 - https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat-site/pull/851 üí° As a reminder, all Nos Gestes Climat public service developments are made transparently on the Github platform, both on the site side and on the calculation model side. See you soon for more great news!
